timeline.message:
Improve docker error message

Adds more information to docker failures, so instead of not very helpful
```
Process 'command '/usr/bin/docker'' finished with non-zero exit value 1
```
it now prints a more actionable message such as
```
Error occurred running command [/usr/bin/docker version --format {{.Server.Versi
on}}] stderr: [Got permission denied while trying to connect to the Docker daemo
n socket at unix:///var/run/docker.sock: Get http://%2Fvar%2Frun%2Fdocker.sock/v
1.40/version: dial unix /var/run/docker.sock: connect: permission denied] stdout
: []
```

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be more readable with stderr and stdout moved to their own lines.
timeline.author: rjernst

timeline.bodyText: Rather than doing this via generic exception handling let's set spec.setIgnoreExitValue(true) and throw our own exception if the result is a non-zero exit value. That way if we blow up for some other reason (bad config, Gradle issue) we aren't returning a potentially misleading exception message.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

timeline.message: Use error code instead of generic exception interception

timeline.bodyText: This seems unnecessary to me. This final message is meant to be a catch-all anyway so I don't think there's much benefit in trying to be any more specific in the error message.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: It was helpful to me to figure out which command docker is failing on my machine, so I can run this command and see if it works or not. I am ok with removing it, since the error message was more helpful anyway.
replies.author: imotov

replies.bodyText: If we consider this valuable I'd prefer we wire the actual command through Result and just display that in this error rather than a simple hard-coded description.
replies.author: mark-vieira

timeline.message: Remove operation from the error log message
